data.text:
The United Nations (UN) is the largest universal multilateral international organisation in the world and it is not surprising that everyone dreams of being hired by this esteemed organisation. Securing employment with such an organisation can be a daunting experience, but as the scope of its work is global and multidimensional. Here are some of the 4 most common avenues available to help you get your foot at the door in this organisation. https://lnkd.in/dtuKrG2C

Introducing the Outbound Permanence Service This webinar was designed for local authorities that may be new to the Outbound service, want to find out what we offer and hear some initial guidance on how to approach overseas placements. https://ow.ly/FARs50RvOEK

A Small Nation can also have the power to lead and grow in the multipolar global order. One of the prominent examples of this is #Singapore. The Issue Brief by our Research Intern, Anu Chauhan analyses the historical background and features of Singapore's #ForeignPolicy. Click the link below to read more https://lnkd.in/dW5qHDmp #southeastasia #internationalrelations #southeastasianstudies

ICT? ITC? (#ITU?) Would you agree with my UN colleague Yiying Zhang in her funny yet serious video: the United Nations is a complex system? But the UN is crucial in a world that needs fixing. The International Telecommunication Union will be at the UN Entities Fair at the United Nations Office at Geneva on 12 October. We will explain how new diplomats in Geneva can work with us UN agencies, e.g. with ITU to connect the world.
